_annotator_notes: Example ground truth - expand with additional obligations as needed

obligations.description: Hold all Confidential Information in strict confidence
obligations.source_text: The Receiving Party agrees: (a) To hold all Confidential Information in strict confidence

obligations.description: Not disclose Confidential Information to third parties without prior written consent
obligations.source_text: Not to disclose any Confidential Information to any third party without the prior written consent of the Disclosing Party

obligations.description: Not use Confidential Information for any purpose other than the Purpose
obligations.source_text: Not to use any Confidential Information for any purpose other than the Purpose

obligations.description: Limit access to Confidential Information to employees/contractors with need to know who are bound by confidentiality
obligations.source_text: To limit access to Confidential Information to those employees, contractors, and advisors who have a need to know such information for the Purpose and who are bound by confidentiality obligations at least as restrictive as those contained herein

obligations.description: Protect Confidential Information with reasonable care (at least same as own confidential info)
obligations.source_text: To protect Confidential Information using the same degree of care that it uses to protect its own confidential information, but in no event less than reasonable care

obligations.description: Give prompt written notice if required to disclose by law and cooperate to obtain protective order
obligations.conditions: If disclosure required by law, regulation, or court order
obligations.source_text: the Receiving Party gives the Disclosing Party prompt written notice of such requirement and cooperates with the Disclosing Party's efforts to obtain a protective order or other appropriate remedy

obligations.description: Return or destroy all Confidential Information upon request or termination
obligations.conditions: Upon Disclosing Party's written request, or upon termination/expiration
obligations.source_text: Upon the Disclosing Party's written request, or upon termination or expiration of this Agreement, the Receiving Party shall promptly: (a) Return to the Disclosing Party all documents, materials, and other tangible items containing Confidential Information; or (b) Destroy all such documents, materials, and items, and provide written certification of such destruction signed by an authorized officer of the Receiving Party

obligations.description: Provide 30 days written notice to terminate
obligations.source_text: Either Party may terminate this Agreement at any time by providing thirty (30) days' prior written notice to the other Party

obligations.description: Confidentiality obligations survive for 7 years (or longer for trade secrets)
obligations.source_text: The obligations of confidentiality and non-use set forth in this Agreement shall survive termination or expiration of this Agreement for a period of seven (7) years, or with respect to trade secrets, for as long as such information remains a trade secret under applicable law

obligations.description: Non-solicitation of employees for 2 years post-termination
obligations.source_text: During the term of this Agreement and for a period of two (2) years following termination, neither Party shall, directly or indirectly, solicit for employment or hire any employee of the other Party with whom it has had contact in connection with the Purpose, without the prior written consent of the other Party

Each Party agrees not to circumvent, avoid, bypass, or obviate the other Party, directly or indirectly, in any manner whatsoever, with respect to any business opportunities, contacts, or transactions introduced by the other Party in connection with the Purpose. This non-circumvention obligation shall survive termination of this Agreement for a period of three (3) years

obligations.description: Cannot assign agreement without prior written consent (with exceptions)
obligations.conditions: Except for affiliates or M&A transactions
obligations.source_text: Neither Party may assign or transfer this Agreement or any rights or obligations hereunder without the prior written consent of the other Party, except that either Party may assign this Agreement to an affiliate or in connection with a merger, acquisition, or sale of substantially all of its assets

obligations.description: Attempt good faith negotiations before arbitration
obligations.conditions: Any dispute arising from the agreement
obligations.source_text: The Parties shall first attempt to resolve the dispute through good faith negotiations; If negotiations fail within thirty (30) days, either Party may initiate binding arbitration

obligations.description: Indemnify other party for breaches including attorneys' fees
obligations.conditions: Upon breach of agreement or unauthorized disclosure
obligations.source_text: Each Party (the "Indemnifying Party") agrees to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the other Party and its officers, directors, employees, agents, and affiliates from and against any and all claims, damages, losses, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees) arising out of or relating to: (a) Any breach of this Agreement by the Indemnifying Party; (b) Any unauthorized disclosure or use of Confidential Information

obligations.description: Comply with export control laws for Confidential Information
obligations.source_text: Each Party agrees to comply with all applicable export control laws and regulations in connection with any Confidential Information disclosed hereunder

risk_flags.title: Long confidentiality survival period
risk_flags.description: Confidentiality obligations survive for 7 years after termination, which is longer than typical NDAs (usually 2-5 years)
risk_flags.source_text: The obligations of confidentiality and non-use set forth in this Agreement shall survive termination or expiration of this Agreement for a period of seven (7) years

risk_flags.title: Non-solicitation of employees
risk_flags.description: 2-year non-solicitation restriction may limit hiring flexibility
risk_flags.source_text: During the term of this Agreement and for a period of two (2) years following termination, neither Party shall, directly or indirectly, solicit for employment or hire any employee of the other Party

risk_flags.title: Non-circumvention clause
risk_flags.description: Broad non-circumvention language could restrict legitimate business activities with contacts introduced during discussions
risk_flags.source_text: Each Party agrees not to circumvent, avoid, bypass, or obviate the other Party, directly or indirectly, in any manner whatsoever, with respect to any business opportunities, contacts, or transactions introduced by the other Party

risk_flags.title: Mandatory binding arbitration
risk_flags.description: Disputes must go to binding arbitration in San Francisco, which may be inconvenient and expensive
risk_flags.source_text: either Party may initiate binding arbitration administered by JAMS in San Francisco, California

risk_flags.title: Jury trial waiver
risk_flags.description: Both parties waive right to jury trial, limiting legal options
risk_flags.source_text: EACH PARTY HEREBY WAIVES ANY RIGHT TO A JURY TRIAL IN ANY PROCEEDING ARISING OUT OF OR RELATING TO THIS AGREEMENT

risk_flags.title: Vague 'need to know' standard
risk_flags.description: The 'need to know' standard is subjective and could lead to disagreements
risk_flags.source_text: those employees, contractors, and advisors who have a need to know such information for the Purpose

key_definitions.definition: Any and all information or data disclosed by one Party to the other in connection with the Purpose, including technical, business, product, and personnel information
Development and integration of artificial intelligence solutions for enterprise data management

_annotation_notes: This is an example annotation. Review carefully and add any missed obligations. The 'is_reader' field assumes TechVentures is the reviewing party - adjust based on your perspective.
